item.title: BlackRock Talks to Buy Private-Credit Firm HPS Advance
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- BlackRock Inc. is in advanced talks to buy HPS Investment Partners, emerging as the only suitor in active talks with the firm as the world’s largest asset manager seeks to compete in the fast-growing private credit industry. The two sides are seeking to reach an agreement by the end o...

item.title: German Inflation Ticks Up Sharply, Highlights ECB Challenge
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- German inflation quickened more sharply than expected and exceeded the European Central Bank’s 2% target – underpinning the challenges for policymakers in deciding on the pace and extent of further monetary-policy easing. Consumer-price growth in Europe’s largest economy picked up to ...

item.title: ECB Mustn’t Rush Further Interest-Rate Cuts, Schnabel Says
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- The European Central Bank shouldn’t hurry to lower borrowing costs and go below the so-called neutral rate to stimulate the economy, according to Executive Board member Isabel Schnabel. While disinflation remains well on track, “the fight against inflation has not yet been won,” she s...

item.title: BlackRock, Vanguard Stakes in Banks Draw Labor Union Critics
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Consumer advocacy groups and labor unions are lining up to support plans by the FDIC to step up scrutiny of stakes in US banks held by money managers such as BlackRock Inc. and Vanguard Group Inc., citing the danger of too much concentration. The groups made their case in a letter sen...

item.title: UBS Wins $282 Million Cut in Damages Bill to Georgian Tycoon
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- UBS Group AG says its won a $282 million reduction in damages it owes to Bidzina Ivanishvili, the controversial Georgian tycoon and political leader who fell victim to a massive embezzlement scheme by a rogue banker at Credit Suisse. Singapore’s International Commercial Court ordered ...

item.title: UBS Profit Outstrips Expectations as CEO Warns on Looming Risks
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- UBS Group AG posted results that beat expectations across the board, as risks from regulation to market gyrations appear on the horizon. Listen to the Here’s Why podcast on Apple, Spotify or anywhere you listen. Shares in the Zurich-based bank briefly rose to the highest since May 20...

item.title: Amundi’s Assets Under Management Rise to a Record €2.19 Trillion
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Amundi posted third-quarter adjusted net income that beat analysts’ estimates as an increase in assets helped lift management fees 9.2%. Assets under management rose 11% from a year earlier to a record €2.19 trillion ($2.37 trillion), the Paris-based asset manager said in a statement ...

Die Bank weist einen Dreimonatsgewinn von 1,4 Mrd. Dollar aus. Sie betont, dass dieser un...

Er warnte davor, dass nationale Interessen die Bankenkonsolidierung in Europa ausbremsen könnten. ► Kommentar auf dieser Seite ► Bericht Seite 7...

Trotzdem kann die Großbank ihre Aktionäre nicht ganz bei der Stange halten. Sie muss noch besser werden, um bei den Investoren die Nase vorn zu behalten. Börs...
